search_matches.text:
NEW PAGE 55
CHAPTER 5: NONCONFORMITIES
5.9.7 Existing Driveways
When sites with existing driveways comprising the entire frontage of a parcel along streets maintained by
the Town of China Grove are redeveloped or experience a change of use that results in an expansion of
required parking, existing driveway width shall be reduced to channelize ingress/egress. This requirement
shall include physically removing paved areas as determined necessary by the TRC. The TRC shall also
review and approve driveways on Town-maintained streets.
Section 5.10 Nonconforming Parking Lot Landscaping for Expansions of Parking or
Building Expansions or Redevelopment
A. For parking lots being expanded, the new parking lot and streetyard standards apply only to the
expanded area, but the plantings may be dispersed throughout the entire parking lot or streetyard.
B. For developments where the building(s) are being expanded or redeveloped, the new streetyard and
parking area landscaping requirements will be applied in a ratio similar to the percentage of gross floor
area of building expansion or redevelopment. If expansion or redevelopment involves 50% or less of
existing building square footage, parking lot and streetyard planting upgrades will apply at the same
rate as the percentage expansion; if building expansion is 51%-80%, the planting upgrades will be at a
rate of 50% of the new planting standards; if building expansion is 81% or higher, planting upgrades
will be at 100% of the new planting standards).
C. When upgraded plantings for parking lots or streetyards are at a rate of less than 100%, the plantings
may be dispersed throughout the parking lot and throughout the streetyard.
Expansion of 50% or less
Expansion of 51-80%
Expansion of 81% or more
Section 5.11 Nonconforming Manufactured Homes and Manufactured Home Parks
A. Nonconforming manufactured homes on individual lots may not be replaced except with a use that
conforms with all the requirements of this Ordinance for the zoning district in which located.
B. Nonconforming manufactured homes may be placed and replaced in nonconforming manufactured
home parks SO long as the manufactured home park retains its nonconforming status, meets
the
requirements of Section 8.23 and Section 5.11C below, and the space was designed and arranged
as
a
manufactured home space prior to the adoption of this Ordinance.
5-7
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 56
CHAPTER 5: NONCONFORMITIES
C.
A nonconforming manufactured home park granted a certificate of continuation may continue to
operate, provided the manufactured home park meets one of the following conditions:
1. The manufactured home park may be reconstructed to meet all of the requirements of Section 7.6
and Section 8.24. The manufactured home park shall be in an R-MH zoning district and shall be
subject to the issuance of a Special Use Permit by the Town Council following the Special Use
Permit approval process set forth in Chapter 17. All reconstruction is to be done without extension
or enlargement of the nonconforming situation. This condition may be met at any time prior to the
date of required cessation.
2. All nonconforming manufactured home parks will be given the option of subdividing the property
into individual lots. To be eligible to qualify under this condition the manufactured home park
must be located within an R-MH zoning district. Each individual lot must satisfy the lot size, lot
width, setbacks, street access requirement, and all other requirements for subdivision within said
zoning district. Each manufactured home must meet all requirements set forth in Section 8.23.
Furthermore, no additional land may be used to meet these requirements. No additional
nonconforming manufactured homes shall be brought onto the property nor shall any
nonconforming manufactured home be replaced at any time. This option shall cease to be available
upon the final date of cessation for manufactured home parks.
3. The manufactured home park continues to meet these minimum standards:
a. Minimum site area (in acres): 1.5
b. Minimum number of Manufactured home Spaces per park: 6
C. Maximum number of Manufactured home Spaces per acre: 8
d. Minimum area per Manufactured home Space
Single-wide: 3500 square feet
Multi-sectional: 4200 square feet
e. Minimum area per Manufactured home Space width
Single-wide: 38 linear feet
Multi-sectional: 50 linear feet
f.
Maximum number of Manufactured homes per Mobile Home Space:
1
g. Minimum number of Parking Spaces per Mobile Home Space (located on each space): 2
h. Minimum area of landing/patio per Manufactured home Space (located on each space): 32
square feet
i.
Minimum width of paved or graveled private street: NCDOT standards for two-way street; 12
feet for one-way street
j.
Minimum percentage of Manufactured home Spaces with approved water supply and sewage
disposal facilities: 100 percent
k.
Minimum percentage Manufactured Home Spaces with garbage collection/disposal services
provided by owner/operator: 100 percent
1. Minimum separation between each unit: 20 linear feet
m. Identification Sign conforming to Chapter 11 required
n. Vehicle speed control devices required
O. Accessory buildings prohibited between manufactured home and street
p. Accessory buildings to be on same space as principal manufactured home
q. Skirting shall be of material acceptable for exterior construction that will not support
combustion. Skirting material shall be durable and suitable for exterior exposures. Any wood
framing used to support this skirting shall be approved moisture resistant treated wood.
Skirting shall be continuous and unpierced except for ventilation. Skirting manufactured
5-8
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 57
CHAPTER 5: NONCONFORMITIES
specifically for underpinning shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's
specifications. Skirting shall be kept in good repair.
Section 5.12 Nonconforming Adult Oriented Businesses
A. Any Adult Oriented Business that fails to comply with the use and locational requirements of this
Ordinance but which was lawfully operating before the effective date of this Ordinance, shall not be
deemed to be in violation of this Ordinance but shall be nonconforming. Any such business which
ceases active operation for a period of 30 days regardless of the purpose or reason shall be subject to
all the requirements of this Ordinance and the property may thereafter be used only for conforming
uses.
B. Any Adult Oriented Business lawfully operating as of the effective date of this Ordinance, but which
subsequently fails to comply with the use and locational requirements of this Ordinance as the result
of changes within the vicinity or amendment to this Ordinance, shall not be deemed to be in violation
of this Ordinance but shall be nonconforming. Any such business which ceases active operation for a
period of 30 days regardless of purpose or reason shall be subject to all the requirements of this
Ordinance and the property may thereafter be used only for conforming uses.
C. Any Adult Oriented Business that is rendered a nonconforming use as a result of (A) and (B) above
shall either cease to operate or meet all of the requirements of this Ordinance for the use no later than
five (5) years from the date that the Adult Oriented Business becomes a nonconforming use.
5-9
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

search_matches.text:
NEW PAGE 54
CHAPTER 5: NONCONFORMITIES
graded gravel, crushed-stone or similar dust-reducing surface) if the parking lot prior to said expansion
was not paved.
Section 5.9 Nonconforming Sites and Buildings Developed Prior to August 1, 2006
5.9.1 Applicability
Standards of Section 5.9 shall only apply to buildings 5,000 square feet or less in size in the N-C, C-B, and
H-B zoning districts.
5.9.2 Development Plan Requirements
Re-use projects meeting the criteria of Section 5.9 shall follow the development plan requirements for
Minor Site Plans outlined in Section 18.6.2.
5.9.3 Exemption From Building Design Guidelines
Re-use projects meeting the criteria of Section 5.9 shall be exempt from the building design requirements
of this ordinance. Building Design requirements shall still apply to any additions to existing structures.
5.9.4 Landscaping
Landscaping for re-use projects developed according to this Section shall meet the standards set forth in
Chapter 11 to the greatest extent possible. When plantings are not possible, alternatives such as decorative
fencing or planter boxes/pots should be implemented based on the table below:
5.9.5 Parking Requirements
The Parking Requirements of Chapter 10 shall be met where possible. The Zoning Administrator is
authorized to approve a reduction of up to 33% in the minimum parking ratios of Section 10.2 For buildings
in existence before August 1, 2006 when such a reduction will facilitate increased compliance with
landscaping or dumpster storage area requirements.
The TRC may approve design alternatives exceeding those which may be granted by the Zoning
Administrator where appropriate.
Requirements for additional parking and loading spaces triggered by building additions shall only apply to
the expanded building area, and shall not apply to the existing square footage on-site.
5.9.6 Paving Requirements
Existing sites requiring less than 10 spaces shall not be required to improve existing gravel parking with
asphalt, concrete, or similar materials permanent wearing surface. Existing parking areas used to meet
parking requirements must be maintained and repaired to good condition, free of potholes.
5-6
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

apply to the entire development
